Created an attachment (id=33166)
patch to delay requiring the XSDEditor

Attaching a patch to avoid requiring the XSDEditor just to configure the outline.  It is still used later.

This bug can easily be reproduced from the GUI by:
1. start the workbench with no .xsd files open
2. open a .xsd file using the xsd editor
3. open the same file using the xml editor

This bug may prohibit our adoption of WST 1.0 for my company's product.

Nitin, does your patch fix this bug, you mean? (If so, why not apply it?). 

Craig, we should test/evaluate for 1.0.1, given news group complaints and Walter's comment #3. 

Walter, just out of curiosity, what is your scenerio that requires file to be opened in both editors? Or was this just an example to reproduce?

Good question.  We don't have a use case that forces the file to be open in both editors, just that once the NPEs became regular in our application, I started experimenting and almost immediately encountered the NPE.

Also, I very quickly reproduced the same NPE by opening several XSD files in the editor, shutting down the workbench with the XSD editors still open, and then starting the workbench.  Doesn't give the NPE every time, but often does.  And this is a use case that our customers will often use.

Thanks for looking at this!

(In reply to comment #3)
> Nitin, does your patch fix this bug, you mean? (If so, why not apply it?). 

It doesn't completely fix the problems, no.  While it works around any timing problems opening an XSD file with the XSD editor (usually from part activation not having been done yet), it still requires that the corresponding editor be an XSDEditor--which it's not in one of Walter's use cases.

I opened an XSD file with XML editor, and the outline is open at the same time. I got the same NPE.  

By my investigation, StructuredTextEditor in SSE creates XSDContentOutlineConfiguration for the outline of the file. 
So, XSDContentOutlineConfiguration is used to configure the outline.
In class XSDContentOutlineConfiguration, getXSDEditor() expects to get XSDEditor. However, the active editor is XMLMultiPageEditorPart instead of XSDEditor if opening the file with XML editor, so getXSDEditor() return NULL. 
Therefore, getXSDEditor().getXSDModelAdapterFactory().getShowReferences() throws NPE at XSDContentOutlineConfiguration.java:240.

To solve the problem, StructuredTextEditor in SSE should create XMLContentOutlineConfiguration instead of XSDContentOutlineConfiguration for the outline. 

Suggestion:
The target of contentOutlineConfiguration element in plugin.xml, is changed to org.eclipse.wst.xsd.ui.internal.XSDEditor.

Created an attachment (id=37173)
Patch to fix the NPE caused by opening XSD file with XML editor while the outline is showing

Jiong's patch is simpler and gets us around the problem, but I'd rather see the XSD configuration changed so it does not require the XSD editor.

The HTML and JSP components have already undergone this type of refactoring at adopter request.  For that adopter, the HTML and JSP outlines are used without a StructuredTextEditor present.

An adopter reported generating this exceptions with the following steps

New EAR project
open application.xml
Cntrl-click on http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee, to open the .xsd file
